articles.title: Autistic man (23) ‘trapped’ in psychiatric unit for five years as HSE fails to secure accommodation
articles.description: Man’s family cannot visit him and are only allowed to receive phone calls from him inside facility
articles.content:
Robert Brady: his mother says he was 'abruptly removed' from a Camhs facility on his 18th birthday and taken to Tallaght University Hospital psychiatric unit.

articles.title: Nintendo Switch 2 gaming console sells a record 3.5 million units in four days
articles.description: The much-anticipated Nintendo Switch 2 has set a new benchmark in gaming following its June 5 launch, selling more than 3.5 million units worldwide.
articles.content:
The much-anticipated Nintendo Switch 2 has set a new benchmark in gaming following its June 5 launch.
The console sold over 3.5 million units globally in just four days, securing the title of the fastest-selling Nintendo game system ever. Featuring a... [1182 chars]

articles.title: NASA is shutting down some official social media accounts, including the Curiosity rover's handle
articles.description: NASA has announced plans to archive, consolidate or rebrand some of its social media accounts in an attempt to make information easier to find.
articles.content: NASA is shutting down several social media accounts run by the Science Mission Directorate, including the official Mars Curiosity Rover account on X. The organization says it made the decision in order to "make its work more accessible to the public,... [1520 chars]

articles.title: Major projects will be slowed by court challenges if rights are violated: B.C. chief
articles.description: The regional chief for British Columbia said Wednesday that governments should not speed up major projects at the expense of First Nations rights, warning that the projects will be slowed down by court challenges if First Nations are not consulted from the start.
articles.content: Photo: The Canadian Press Regional Chief Terry Teegee speaks as he is joined by AFN National Chief Cindy Woodhouse Nepinak, back left, and Chair of the B.C. First Nations Justice Council Kory Wilson (Hemas Kla-Lee-Lee-Kla) on Parliament Hill in Ottaw... [1842 chars]

articles.title: Harvey Weinstein found guilty of criminal sexual act in New York retrial
articles.description: The case was being retried after an appeals court overturned his 2020 conviction last year.
articles.content:
Disgraced movie mogul Harvey Weinstein has been found guilty of committing a criminal sexual act in a retrial in New York.
The 73-year-old was found not guilty of another count of committing a criminal sexual act relating to a second woman.
